Html:
Hi everyone, I want to create a shared view in Prism. Any helps?

Here is my situation:
module 1 with view1 display order items.
module 2 with shared view 2 display order item details.

when user clicks on one order item in view1, view2 displays and show the detail of selected order item on one MDI window(I am using wpfmdi control); at the same time, if user clicks on another order item in view1, what i expect the result is view2 shows up again with the detail of picked order item on another MDI window, is it possible to make this? how?
Seems that I need to use scoped region, could some help give me some code example as I am totally new to Prism, thanks in advance.

Hi,

Based on my understanding on your scenario, there is no need for you to use scoped regions in this case, as you can show multiple instances of a view using any of the approaches that are mentioned in the following chapters of Prism documentation:
  • Chapter 7: Composing the User Interface
  • Chapter 8: Navigation
If you are experiencing any issue with this, it would be helpful if you can provide us with more information about what problem you are experiencing.

Regards,
